title: Non trapped error when depending on a non-existing variant
body:
When package_b:
depends_on('package_a+non_existing_variant)

then sometimes the error does not get trapped

-----

make an error in dependency like 
depends_on('tcl+missing_tcl_variant')

### Expected Result
==> Error: Package tcl has no variant set(['missing_tcl_variant'])!

### Actual Result

==> Error: 'missing_tcl_variant'


### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack edit tk
:1,$s/'tcl'/'tcl+missing_tcl_variant'
:wq
$ spack spec tk
==> Error: 'missing_tcl_variant'    <-----------_ non informative error, not trapped:
lib/spack/spack/variant.py", line 613, in substitute_abstract_variants
    pkg_variant = spec.package_class.variants[name]
KeyError: 'missing_tcl_variant'

 instead, for unknown reason, spec python+tk correctly trap
$ spack -d spec python+tk
...............
lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 2228, in validate_or_raise
    raise UnknownVariantError(spec.name, not_existing)
spack.variant.UnknownVariantError: Package tcl has no variant set(['missing_tcl_variant'])!
